intro: Geissorhiza excisa, commonly known as the yellow orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces showy, spurred flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
